alert.note: Alert for Butler; Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 22 at 1:28PM CST until February 22 at 2:00PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Wayne County in southeastern Missouri... Butler County in southeastern Missouri... * Until 200 PM CST. * At 127 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sam A. Baker State Park to near Success, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Lodi around 135 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Cascade and Qulin. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southeastern Missouri. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southeastern Missouri.
